channel.title: Old_contents on FOSS4G 2024
channel.description: Recent content in Old_contents on FOSS4G 2024

item.title: Call for papers: Academic program
item.description: Academic program submissions timeline Call for papers: 4 December 2023 - 11 February 2024 Announce accepted talks 3 March 2024 Full program 31 March 2024 Submission of full academic papers 3 May 2024 Conference: 2 December - 8 December 2024 Submit an academic proposal Description Following the established tradition, an Academic Track running over the days of the FOSS4G Europe (FOSS4GE) is organised.

item.title: Call for papers: Workshops
item.description: Workshops submissions timeline Call for workshops: 27 November 2023 - 14 January 2024 Community voting period: 15 January 2024 - 28 January 2024 Announce accepted workshops: 11 February 2024 Full program: 31 March 2024 Workshops: 1 July - 2 July 2024 Submit a workshop Description Workshops are the practical hands-on sessions to acquire new know-how in the use of FOSS4G software.

item.title: Call for papers: General program
item.description: General program submissions timeline Call for papers: 27 November 2023 - 11 February 2024 Community voting period: 12 February 2024 - 25 February 2024 Announce accepted talks: 3 March 2024 Full program: 31 March 2024 Conference: 2 December - 8 December 2024 Submit a talk Description Free and Open Source Software for Geospatial (FOSS4G) Europe is the regional flagship event of OSGeo - an open, grassroots and dynamic community.

item.title: Call for sponsors
item.description: The Free and Open Source for Geospatial (FOSS4G) Europe conference is the main OSGeo regional European community meetup.

item.title: About FOSS4G 2024 Belém, Brasil
item.description: About FOSS4G 2024 The Free and Open Source Software for Geospatial (FOSS4E) conference is the Open Source Geospatial Foundation (OSGeo) annual conference.

item.title: Call for papers
item.description: Call for workshops submissions 27 November 2023 - 14 January 2024

item.title: Code of Conduct
item.description: This Code of Conduct governs how we behave in any OSGeo forum or event and whenever we will be judged by our actions.
